channel.title: How to build a computer?
channel.description:
Hello,
Does anyone know any websites or any other sources that detail on how to build your own computer. I was going to buy an alienware computer, but now I decided that I would like to build my own. I don't know where to get the framing though (the computer without anything in it). Does anyone know where to get it?
Also, which sites would you recommend for buying computer parts from? Since this is a large community, some people have probably bought computer parts online from various sites. So, please recommend me to some good websites.
Thanks, Leader

item.title: How to build a computer?
item.dc:creator: @error.login cane
item.description:
@error.login wrote:

OK, then we’re going to start from scratch.

  1. Remove EVERYTHING from the case
  2. Set the motherboard on a non conductive surface. The motherboard box is perfect for this. .DO NOT PLACE THE MOTHERBOARD ON THE STATIC BAG! It can acually conduct electricity! We are going to try and assemble a running system outside of the case.
  3. Install the CPU and heat sink.
  4. Install the RAM (only install 1 stick for SDRAM, 2 for RDRAM)
  5. Install the video card
  6. Connect the monitor to the video card.
  7. Connect the power supply to the motherboard.
  8. Connect power to the power supply
  9. Do NOT connect ANYTHING else. Make sure you have the power connector on the CPU fan connected.
  10. Use a small screwdriver to momentarily short the power switch connector on the motherboard.

If all is well, it should power up and you should get a display. If not, then you most likely have a faulty component. Do this and and post your results, then we will get it all assembled in the case and get this thing running.

The voices in my head think that my imaginary friend has SERIOUS issues!

-Switching to Glide…Balancing in my head…inside of me…
taking the glide path instead.

i took this text from here]http://forum.pcmech.com/showthread.php?t=132409]here

Read full topic

item.title: How to build a computer?
item.dc:creator: @error.login cane
item.description:
@error.login wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:12, topic:89840”]If you live in the USA http://www.newegg.com/ is the place you want to get your parts from, I order stuff from them all the time and they are cheap and fast with shipping. You can get everything there you need to build a computer.

Don’t buy alienware, you are just paying for the fancy case, for example I built my computer with parts from newegg about 3 months ago, it cost me $550, and the same parts to build the computer from dell.com cost $1600, if I wanted it built for me it would probably be well over $2000. So I saved a LOT of money building it myself, and it took less than 30 minutes. (it might take you 45-60 if this is your first computer, I’ve built a few)[/quote]
mopar u gave me an idea and another topic as well (the one on wiping all your drives)

heres my plan:
build a few computers and sell them to frends/family/hobos

Read full topic

item.title: How to build a computer?
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

If you live in the USA http://www.newegg.com/ is the place you want to get your parts from, I order stuff from them all the time and they are cheap and fast with shipping. You can get everything there you need to build a computer.

Don’t buy alienware, you are just paying for the fancy case, for example I built my computer with parts from newegg about 3 months ago, it cost me $550, and the same parts to build the computer from dell.com cost $1600, if I wanted it built for me it would probably be well over $2000. So I saved a LOT of money building it myself, and it took less than 30 minutes. (it might take you 45-60 if this is your first computer, I’ve built a few)

Read full topic

item.description:
@error.login wrote:

well i would say buy but if your feeling luckey build it because it can meet your every need and its a great learning curve and btw buy all shit parts ect and use them and untill you have built atleased like 3 pc’s then have go at your gaming computer, but dell make it for your every need right?

*has a brain wave

Read full topic

item.title: How to build a computer?
item.dc:creator: @leader leader
item.description:
@leader wrote:

The Un-Named:

Also, if you need a cheap ass computer to practice further on, DellOutlet has some pretty good ones for as cheap as $240.

I don’t need a cheap computer. I just want to build my own. Thanks though.
Also, they are refurbished computers.

Original Daniel:

He just told you, and you might want to practice taking apart and putting your old computer together first. No matter how many guides you have read, they have nothing on experience, and it is very easy to throw away a grand because you’re excited to get it all together. I know someone who was confident because he read a bunch of guides, then put the motherboard straight on the case and short circuited it.

I was going to take my computer apart and see which parts go where before you said to. I’m not going to put chips in random slots. Thanks for the tip, however.

I got one last, final question. Do you think I should buy an alienware computer ($3,000) or build a gaming computer? My dad told me to just buy it, but I want to see what you guys think.

Thanks,
Leader

Read full topic
